message: Does anyone else love the Hitman games as much as I do? A new title just got announced, Hitman: Absolution, slated for 2012.
Funny story: the previous Hitman game was one of the first games I'd ever bought for 360, buying it months before I even had the console. And I never played it!
That's Blood Money, right? That's actually the only one I haven't played, and I'm not really sure why.
Blood Money is the best in the series, the one where all the great ideas really come together. You must play it if you're a fan of the franchise.
I've never finished a Hitman game, although I tried them all. Something always seems to get in the way.

My experience with Hitman was playing a demo of the first game and despising it. I ... I should probably forgive it at this point, right? It seems like something I'd really enjoy. Should I be playing all of them, or go straight to Blood Money?

I might have gotten over excited in the first post, but really I have a love/hate relationship with Hitman. The first game is unforgiving, and I wanted to persevere, really, but after about a gajillion tries at one level (at the time I played, they hadn't patched in mid-level saving yet) I gave up.

MrG: Contracts is almost a best of collection of the missions from the first two games, redone, so you might want to start there. I'm not sure how much there is of an over arcing story going into Blood Money, but Contracts at least hinted at it.
I loved Hitman 2 and Contracts though. I should get Blood Money!
